series.title: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
series.author: The Champs

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Champs Farewell/Questlove
episodes.summary:
The Original Champs sit down with Ahmir/Questlove to talk about his life and the sun setting on the podcast.

On behalf of Neal, Moshe and Doug - Thanks for listening. I was so fun to do.  And who knows what the future holds.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jamar Neighbors
episodes.summary: Comedian/Actor/Compton Native Jamar Neighbors sits down with the Champs to discuss maybe being a crack baby, fighting, and crying as a man.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Nicole Byer
episodes.summary: The Champs sit down with Girlcode regular Nicole Byer to discuss the time she married a guy to get him a greencard, body-images and believe it or not, race.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: New Faces 2015
episodes.summary: The Champs sit down with the (black) selections from the Montreal JFL festival.  Is it a mess? Probably. But production has never been the Champs strongsuit.  It's about vibes, bro.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Wanda Sykes
episodes.summary: After a long hiatus, the Champs are back with Wanda Sykes. They discuss Wanda's life, comedy and sexuality.  Recorded Live at the Montreal Just For Laughs Festival 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jerrod Carmichael Returns (w/ Jamar Neighbors)
episodes.summary: The star of the HBO special "Love from The Store" and the forthcoming NBC sitcom sits down with the Champs to discuss working with Spike Lee and what "responsibilities" black artists have.  Also, Jamar is there and we talk to him too.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Ms. Pat
episodes.summary: Comedian Ms. Pat sits down with the Champs to discuss having her first child at 14, selling crack, and getting shot in the tittie.  It's wild, homey.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Tariq/Black Thought (The Roots)
episodes.summary: The Roots MC sits down with The Champs to discuss life on The Tonight Show, growing up rough in Philly, his crazy work ethic and his relationship with Questlove.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Hari Kondabolu
episodes.summary: The Queens, NY native sits down with the Champs to discuss his subversive stand-up, getting his masters degree from the London School of Economimc and his life as a immigrant rights organizer in Seattle up until 2008.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Tiffany Haddish
episodes.summary: Comedian/actress sits down with the Champs to discuss her journey to comedy through family turmoil and the LA foster care system. Funny/emotional Champs.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Baratunde Thurston
episodes.summary: The former Digital editor of The Onion and author of "How To Be Black" sits down with the Champs to talk about why black guys keep getting shot and what the fuck is going on right now?

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: King Bach
episodes.summary: The Florida actor/comedian (you may not have heard of) sits down with the Champs to discuss how he's amassed 9.3 million followers on vine in a year and a half.  Educate yo'self.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Damon Wayans Jr.
episodes.summary: The comedian and actor sits down with The Champs to discuss growing up rich and poor in LA, being a knucklehead, and finally following in his family's footsteps, starring in Let's Be Cops, The Other Guys, The New Girl and Happy Endings.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Danny Brown
episodes.summary: The Detroit rapper and avid Champs listener sits down with said Champs to discuss his love of Dizzee Rascal, medition, his time in prison and his forays into S&M. It's great.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Affion Crockett
episodes.summary: The comedian/impressionist sits down with the Champs to discuss Nick Cannon, making youtube hits and his short lived Fox sketch show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Golden State Warrior Harrison Barnes
episodes.summary: The 3rd Year NBA player sits down with the Champs to discuss the possibility of paying NCAA players, going to chapel with his co-workers, and what he's actually thinking when he's on the floor in the middle of a game.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Seaton Smith (From Fox's "Mulaney")
episodes.summary: The DC bred comedian sits down with the Champs to talk about the time Neal made somebody cry, the craziest stand-up show he ever saw, and of course, Ferguson.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Marina Franklin
episodes.summary: The NYC comedian sits down with the Champs to discuss her rage issues, her racial identity growing up, her recent argument with a cab driver, and a bunch of other troubling things.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Keith Robinson
episodes.summary: The veteran New York comedian sits down with the Champs to discuss his father's criminality, Kevin Hart, and his own love of prostitution.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Pharaohe Monch
episodes.summary: The god MC (and funny dude) sits down with the Champs to discuss clinical depression, Kanye West, and his process of rewriting lyrics.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jean Grae
episodes.summary: The NY MC sits down with the Champs to discuss growing up in Manhattan, how she deals with beat thieves and dudes in general.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: George Wallace
episodes.summary: The comedy legend sits down with The Champs to discuss driving cross country with Jerry Seinfeld in 1976, watching Richard Pryor struggle and how he stays young.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: SNL's Jay Pharoah
episodes.summary: The Master Impressionist sits down with the Champs to discuss how he got on SNL, scrapping with his dad, and dating a woman who was in the popular street gang, The Bloods.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Cristela Alonzo
episodes.summary: Comedian Cristele Alonzo sits down with the Champs to discuss her journey from growing up in an abandoned diner in Texas to doing stand-up in LA and finally landing a sitcom pilot for ABC.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Freddie Gibbs
episodes.summary: The Gary, Indiana rapper sits down with the Champs to discuss being a thug, his failling out with Young Jeezy, and how he wants to get with Katy Perry.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Russell Simmons
episodes.summary: The hip-hop legend sits down with the Champs for an all too short interview regarding his new book about yoga, what he tells young stars, and the beginning of Def Jam records.  His final line is bananas.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Daily Show writer Travon Free
episodes.summary: The Compton born and raised writer/comedian sits down with the Champs to drop insight about security at Target (where he worked) and how he came to get a writing job at "The Daily Show w/ Jon Stewart." You may not know who he is, but this is a great episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Hot 97 DJ Cipha Sounds
episodes.summary: The morning radio personality sits down with the Champs to discuss how his father died, going to therapy with his wife, and that time he offended the entire Haitian community.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Wyatt Cenac
episodes.summary: The former Daily Show correspondant sits down with the Champs to discuss all kinds of stuff.  In short, this is the most psychologically revealing Champs episode ever, guest-wise and host-wise.  Family stuff.  Good episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Charlemagne tha god
episodes.summary: The morning radio DJ and host of MTV2's "Charlemagne and Friends" sits down with the Champs to discuss dealing drugs, going to prison, girls, erectile dysfunction, and how he came up.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Action Bronson
episodes.summary: The New York rapper sits down with the Champs to discuss smoking weed with his bad-bitch mother, the stupidity of his name and what makes for a great album.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Arsenio
episodes.summary: The Late night legend sits down with the Champs to discuss a variety of things, including how his career began, Richard Pryor, Jay Leno, Redd Foxx, and of course, the making of "Coming To America."  He also refers to Neal as a "negrophile."  And does a mean Paul Mooney impression.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Maseo from De La Soul
episodes.summary: One third of the legendary hip-hop trio sits down with the Champs to discuss how they made most of their hits while still in school, different kinds of groupies and his Auburn football star son. It's good.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Big Daddy Kane
episodes.summary: The hip-hop legend sits down with the Champs to discuss Biggie, Tupac, Color Me Badd, battle rapping, Madonna and of course, premature ejactulation. Also, he tells the craziest sex story in Champs history. He's a quiet, hilarious man.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: MC Serch
episodes.summary: The 3rd Bass MC and current talkshow host, MC Serch, sits down with the Champs to tell his crazy stories about MC Hammer putting a hit out on him, his part in signing Nas, and the craziest story you'll ever hear about Bushwick Bill. Special appearance by Questlove. Great episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Founder of World Star Hip Hop, Q
episodes.summary: The man behind the best online videos of the last five years sits down with the Champs to discuss the origin of the site, his posse, and whether he's responsible for the uplift of black people.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Finesse Mitchell
episodes.summary: Former SNL Cast member and current Disney channel actor (Ant Farm) sits down with the Champs to discuss sexual responsibllity, marriage, and politics.  It's a good ep.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Felipe Esparza Returns
episodes.summary: The returning Champ discusses his rampant, wild, long-term drug use. It's insane.  By the end of the episode, you too will feel like you're on drugs.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Dean Edwards
episodes.summary: Comedian and former SNL Cast member Dean Edwards sits down with the Champs to discuss his corrections officer father, Eddie Murphy, and what the movie of his life would be like.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Corey Holcomb
episodes.summary: The former Last Comic Standing contestant and host of the 5150 Show on Sirius sits down with the Champs to discuss Patrice O'Neal, Michelle Obama, cheating, and who is actually from Chicago.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Roy Wood Returns
episodes.summary: Comedian and cast member of "Sullivan and Son" on TBS, Roy Wood Jr. sits down with the Champs to discuss Kanye's Yeezus show, deciding whether to see "!2 Years a Slave" with a white girl, and the long game of stand-up.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Pootie Tang - Lance Crouther
episodes.summary: Sa-Da-Tay, Pootie himself - Lance Crouther, sits down with the Champs to discuss his career and a comedian and writer, the making of Pootie Tang and working with Chris Rock, Louie CK and the Wu-Tang Clan.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Aries Spears
episodes.summary: Comedian Aries Spears sits down with the Champs to discuss his time on Mad TV, Kevin Hart, and grills Neal about why he thinks Aries hasn't had a better career.  Weirdly emotional and funny.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: busdriver
episodes.summary: Los Angeles rapper busdriver sits down with the Champs to discuss his artful approach to hip-hop, his father writing for "Married With Children," and Jay-Z's latest record.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jordan Peele (Key+Peele)
episodes.summary: The other half of the sketch comedy duo sits down with the Champs to discuss the hit Comedy Central show, cutting back on weed, Burt Reynolds in Amsterdam, race and other Champs issues.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jermaine Fowler
episodes.summary: One the stars of MTV's Guy Code sits down with the Champs to discuss his Muslim twin brother, a teacher choking him, and his mother turning lesbian when he was 20.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Kevin Avery
episodes.summary: The head writer of "Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell" sits down with the Champs to discuss attending Tuskeegee University, his short-lived R&B group and his adjustment to being a professional comedy writer.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: NBA All-Star Baron Davis
episodes.summary: Two time All-Star Baron Davis sits down with the Champs to talk about balling out, growing up in South Central LA, the lonliness of being an NBA Player, and his plans for his potential retirement.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Superhead
episodes.summary: Former hip-hop video vixen and NYTimes Bestselling author Karrine Steffans sits down with the Champs to discuss her harrowing upbringing in St. Thomas, her writing, her break-through video and how she openly cheated on her husband with Lil Wayne.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jay Chandrasekhar
episodes.summary: The director of "Super Troopers" and "Beerfest" sits down with the Champs to discuss his father's penis, snitching in school, and directing movies.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Allen Hughes (Director - Menace II Society + American Pimp)
episodes.summary: Hollywood director Allen Hughes sits down with the Champs to discuss his early work and subsequent beef with Tupac, the making of Menace, and what it's like to direct Denzel Washington.  This is possibly the name-droppiest episode of The Champs.  Also, it's an audio nightmare, but it's a good one.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Lucas Brothers
episodes.summary: The Champs welcome their first twins, the Lucas Bros, who have a show on Fox's ADHD Saturday night line-up this Fall.  They discuss growing up in duplicate, snitching, and their father going to jail for most of their lives.  Good shit.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Michael Che
episodes.summary: Native NYer Michael Che sits down with the Champs to discuss growing up around crackheads in the projects and white kids at school, and how he started stand-up in 2009, quickly landing on Letterman and a writing job at SNL.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Godfrey
episodes.summary: Comedian Godfrey sits down with the Champs to discuss hookers in Brazil, why he's not more famous and why Neal's sort of an asshole.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Reggie Watts
episodes.summary: Comedian/Musician Reggie Watts sits down with the Champs to discuss his days in drama club, how his style was born, and his love of nonsense.  Also, he performs three awesome songs.  Also, Doug quit.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Chris Rock
episodes.summary: A true comedy great sits down with The Champs to discuss his early exposure to white people, Martin Lawrence, Sam Kinison and how he made himself into one of the best comedians ever.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Ali LeRoi (co-creator "Everybody Hates Chris" - "Chris Rock Show")
episodes.summary: Writer and former comedian Ali LeRoi sits down with the Champs to discuss his years opening/writing for Bernie Mac and Chris Rock, the pitfalls of being a black writer in Hollywood, and what's wrong with comedian's personalities.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Aisha Tyler
episodes.summary: The new host of "Who's Line is it, Anyway" sits down with the Champs to discuss bombing onstage, marrying her ex-boyfriend's best friend, and being a black girl at an Ivy League school.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jasper Redd
episodes.summary: Comedian Jasper Redd sets the record for quietest guest ever, so Neal talks about having lunch with Michael Moore and Dick Gregory, then they debate who's had it worse, Jewish people, Native Americans or black people.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Too $hort
episodes.summary: Legendary OAKLAND rapper Too $hort sits down with the Champs to discuss his unprecedented four decade long hip-hop career: from selling mix-tapes on the streets to opening for N.W.A. to "Blow The Whistle." This is a crazy-good episode and Moshe was hard the entire time.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Kumail Nanjiani
episodes.summary: Pakistani-born comedian sits down with the Champs to discuss coming to America, losing his religion, and the first time he touched a woman (at the age of 18.  Yes.  18.).

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Bashir + Diallo
episodes.summary: Former "Late Night w/ Jimmy Fallon" writers Bashir Sallahudin and Diallo Riddle sit down with the Champs to discuss Harvard, the hackiness of Kanye + Kim jokes, and working w/ President Obama on "Slow Jam the News."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Mario Joyner
episodes.summary: Cable TV comedy legend Mario Joyner, host of MTV's 1/2 Hour Comedy Hour, sits down with the Champs to discuss his years on the road, his botched three-way, and his friends Jerry Seinfeld and Chris Rock intervening on his "leisure addiction."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: David Alan Grier Returns
episodes.summary: The good and great David Alan Grier sits down once again with the Champs, this time to talk almost exclusively about women and sex.  Graphic, honest and awesome.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: CNN + ESPN's LZ Granderson
episodes.summary: Journalist LZ Granderson sits down with the Champs to discuss Obama, voting, Bill Walton's overratedness, Nazis, Guns', Roses and being gay.  And of course, black stuff.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Dwayne Perkins
episodes.summary: Comedian Dwayne Perkins sits down with the Champs to discuss girls, comedy and fighting, which leads Moshe and Neal to confess that they believe they could take each other in a fight.  Highly entertaining.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Shawn + Marlon Wayans
episodes.summary: The stars of the Scary Movie franchise as well as the Wayans Brothers sitcom sit down with The Champs to discuss their long careers in comedy, snapping on Eddie Murphy's pants when they were in grade school, Tupac Shakur, and why Shawn drives a minivan.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Riff Raff + Chelsea Peretti
episodes.summary: Riff Raff (Burgeoning hip-hop superstar) and Chelsea Peretti (one of the greats in all of comedy) sit with the Champs, marking the first time two white guests have been allowed on the podcast.  What follows is a clinic in nonsense and stupidity and is another reminder of why white people can't have nice things.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Russell Peters
episodes.summary: Worldwide comedy phenom sits down with the Champs to discuss stand-up in arenas, how his daughter changed his life, and his craziest sex stories.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Anthony Anderson
episodes.summary: The star of "Guys with Kids," "Hustle and Flow" and "The Departed" sits down The Champs to discuss growing up in Compton, his father putting pad-locks on their kitchen cabinets and his first time on the comedy stage.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: NBA Legend John Salley
episodes.summary: Former Detroit Piston and Chicago Bull John Salley sits down with the Champs to discuss growing up in an Italian-Jewish neighborhood in Brooklyn, the changes in the NBA over the years, and how everyone in the hood uses Dial soap.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Rusty Cundieff (Chappelle's Show Director)
episodes.summary: Director Rusty Cundeiff (Chappelle's Show, Human Giant, Fear of a Black Hat, Tales from the Hood) sits down with the Champs to discuss Dennis Miller's early stand-up act, work-place masturbation, black dudes in dresses and happiness. This episode is sponsored by audible. Go to audiblepodcast.com/thechamps for a free audiobook.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Larry Wilmore
episodes.summary: Larry Wilmore is the co-creator of "The Bernie Mac Show" and "The PJs." He was also a writer for "The Office," the Senior Black Corresponent for "The Daily Show," and has a new special on Showtime. He sits down with the Champs to dicuss all of it. Funny, interesting guy.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Aziz Ansari
episodes.summary: The star of "Parks & Rec" and multiple comedy specials sits down with The Champs to discuss his love of carpooling, growing up in the South, his rise to stardom and his admiration for Chris Rock.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Nicole Richie
episodes.summary: The star of "The Simple Life" and "Fashion Star" sits down with the Champs to talk about her father, Lionel, her heroin addiction, her husband Joel Madden from Good Charlotte and her best Michael Jackson story. Also, Neal says she used to be "chunky."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Maronzio Vance
episodes.summary: Maronzio Vance (Comedy Central 1/2 Hour) sits down with the Champs to discuss his time opening for Paul Mooney, the time he asked Neal to mentor him, and why Kevin Hart should thank Katt Williams.  Also, Moshe proposes that people stop using the word, "bitch."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Lil Rel
episodes.summary: The Champs sit down with their first "Lil" guest, Rel Howry, rising star comic from Chicago.  They discuss his father's crying, white people at camp, girls and religion.  S'good.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Blake Griffin Returns
episodes.summary: Original Champ and NBA All-Star Blake Griffin makes his triumphant return to discuss the Clippers season, his knees, the things he needs to do to become a complete player, and the origin of the term "Lob City."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Ron Funches
episodes.summary: Ron Funches is a idiosyncratic black dude from Chicago who moved to Portland and started doing stand-up.  He sat down with the Champs to discuss his recent seperation, kindness in comedy, and poisoning his mother's boyfriend when he was a kid.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: John Legend
episodes.summary: R&B star John Legend sits down with The Champs to discuss getting sued, Kanye's place in hip-hop history, his supermodel girlfriend, Frank Ocean's announcement, and why he doesn't care about rappers who can freestyle.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Retta (From NBC's "Parks and Rec")
episodes.summary: Retta breaks the glass ceiling, becoming the first solo female to ever sit down with the Champs.  They discuss the Adam Carolla controversy, getting started in comedy and being competitive with peers. Also, Neal reveals that he had erectile disfunction in 2005!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Charlie Murphy
episodes.summary: At long last, Charlie Murphy sits down with the Champs to discuss gangs, prison, dicks on cheeks, the Navy, Beirut, Strom Thurmond, fame, violence and machine guns. It's excellent.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Roy Wood, Jr.
episodes.summary: Comedian Roy Wood, Jr. sits down with the Champs to discuss how when he was charged with mail fraud at age 22, he figured he should try stand-up a few times before he was sent away to prison for the rest of his life.  He didn't get sentenced, and got good at comedy, appearing on Letterman and Last Comic Standing.  Also discussed: Neal was once accused of drugging a woman in Las Vegas!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Trevor Noah
episodes.summary: Famous young South African comedian (and future Daily Show host) Trevor Noah sits down with The Champs to discuss his (illegal) upbringing as a child of mixed raced parents in the thick of 1980's Apartheid and how he became a comedian.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Felipe Esparza (Last Comic Standing Winner)
episodes.summary: The Champs welcome their first Latino guest, Filipe Esparza, to discuss the time he bit a dude's ear off after watching "Terminator 2" while he was hight on PCP. his mulitple stints in rehab, and meeting his daughter on myspace.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Pras (from The Fugees)
episodes.summary: One third of the legendary hip-hop group sits down with The Champs to discuss how The Fugees got started, how Wyclef and Lauryn Hill's relationship undid the band, and the time he got kidnapped by Somali Pirates in 2008.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Suli McCullough
episodes.summary: The dude who played Crazy Legs in "Don't Be a Menace..." and Mouse in "The Jamie Foxx Show" sits down with The Champs to discuss his first gigs working with Sam Kinison and Rodney Dangerfield, his writing career, and internet haters.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Baron Vaughn
episodes.summary: Comedian and Actor (Conan, USA's Fairly Legal) Baron Vaughn sits down with the Champs to discuss the in and outs of his Polyamorous lifestyle. That means he has open, honest relationships with multiple woman, as do they. Shit is interesting.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Faizon Love (Big Worm from "Friday")
episodes.summary: This week, The Champs sit around with Faizon Love to discuss doing open mics with Adam Sandler, sharing a car with Chris Tucker when they both thought "Friday" had ruined their careers, and what made him quit drinking.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jose Canseco
episodes.summary: The most notorious man in baseball sits down with the Champs to discuss his All-Star career, his steroid use, and his regrets over writing the tell-all bestseller, "Juiced."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Hannibal Buress
episodes.summary: Comedian Hannibal Buress (Letterman, Comedy Central, 30 Rock) sits down with the Champs to discuss being rejected by prostitutes in Amsterdam, how Mitch Hedberg affected his career, and his years writing for TV. Also discussed: Moshe's book, "Kasher in the Rye," and living forever.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Key (from Key + Peele)
episodes.summary: Keegan-Michael Key sits down with the Champs to discuss his experience driving a crackhead around to do errands and almost dying in Greece, then compares notes with Neal about having a sketch show on Comedy Central.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Questlove
episodes.summary: The Roots drummer/Jimmy Fallon Band Leader sits down with the Champs to discuss beef with Biggie, the Michelle Bachmann scandal, the curse of Black Geniuses, and his friendship with Jay-Z.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: "Cutty" from The WIre - Chad Coleman
episodes.summary: The Champs sit down with one of the stars of "The Wire," to discuss auditioning for the show, the impact it had on his career and bitches throwing they panties at the guy who played Stringer Bell.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Sasha Grey + Flying Lotus (Part 2)
episodes.summary: The Champs continue their conversation with Sasha and FlyLo, delving into Flying Lotus's story, the origin of his sound, and his work with Thom Yorke.  Then they remember that there's a porn star in their midst, and discuss sex injuries, and Sasha's determination to have sex like a man.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Adult Film's Sasha Grey + Musician Flying Lotus
episodes.summary: Adult Film star Sasha Grey sits with the Champs to discuss her hairy muff, not getting punched in the stomach by Rocco Siffredi and the importance of hygiene in a sexual partner.  Meanwhile, Flying Lotus makes a song from scratch live on the show.  It's awesome.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Alonzo Bodden (Last Comic Standing)
episodes.summary: The Winner of Last Comic Standing, Alonzo Bodden, sits with the Champs to discuss his pre-comedy life as a jet engine mechanic, the joy of 3 Ways, and his addiction to crack! (CRACK!)

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: JB Smoove
episodes.summary: "Curb Your Enthusiasm's" JB Smoove sits down with The Champs to break down 'Leon-isms,' 11 piece suits, forcing people to be your friend, and plays a crazy-ass word association game.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Conan's Deon Cole
episodes.summary: Comedian and "Conan" writer Deon Cole sits with the Champs to discuss his friendship with R. Kelly, getting kicked off of Def Comedy Jam, and the time he kissed a dude.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Owen Smith
episodes.summary: Integration is over as the Champs welcome black comedian Owen Smith, who is best known for his appearance on Conan O'Brien and The Ruckus on Comedy Central.  He talks with the Champs about his four years at Notre Dame, black people behaving differently around white people, and why women don't want to date comedians.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Bobby Lee
episodes.summary: The Champs semi-integrate with Korean comedian Bobby Lee, who talks about shitting in his pants during a sketch on Mad TV, only watching porn on BluRay and fighting with his mother.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: The Robot
episodes.summary: Carl Lake, the hilarious, beloved Robot from Chappelle's Show sits down with the Champs to discuss his time as a crackhead and quite possibly the craziest 3-way in the history of Germany.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Byron Bowers
episodes.summary: Atlanta's own Byron Bowers sits down with the Champs to discuss white people's hair, racism, and the Illumuniti!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Eric Andre
episodes.summary: Quickly rising comedian Eric Andre sits down with the Champs to discuss his new show on Adult Swim, his sitcom on ABC, getting handjobs at massage parlors and Moshe's love of rough sex. Also, Neal argues that Jon Hamm has no more right to fame than Snookie.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Wayne Brady
episodes.summary: Neal's old buddy stops by to talk with the Champs to discuss Vegas, Cruise Ships, the Chappelle's Show sketch, the appopriate amount blackness and High School liars.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Champsgiving: Hugh Moore
episodes.summary: He's not famous, but he's really funny.  This week, writer and comedian Hugh Moore sits down with the Champs as they get all introspective and discuss how their parents love affected their lives long-term.  Also, they talk about eating out homeless women.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Adult Film's Lexington Steele
episodes.summary: Multiple AVN Award winning pornstar Lexington Steele sits down with The Champs to discuss his life as a porn star. It's far more interesting and far less gross than you'd guess.  And it's really funny.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Workaholics' Erik Griffin
episodes.summary: The man who plays Montez Walker on Comedy Central's "Workaholics," sits down with the Champs to have an in-depth discussion about the taste of comedy bookers, star-fucking, and Patrice O'Neal.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: David Alan Grier
episodes.summary: "In Living Color" + "Chocolate News" star David Allan Grier gets with the Champs to discuss Kanye West, David Mamet, dissing Jodie Foster and dating younger women.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Robert Townsend
episodes.summary: Comedy Legend/Hero Robert Townsend (Hollywood Shuffle/5 Heart Beats/Raw) joins the Champs to discuss directing Eddie Murphy in "Raw," losing a role on Broadway to Jimmie J.J. Walker,  and the creation of "Hollywood Shuffle."

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Tony Rock
episodes.summary: This edition, Comedian/Actor/Chris Rock's Brother Tony Rock sits in with The Champs.  Subjects discussed: belief in a god, the ethics of reading a person's texts if you find their phone, and the quickest meeting-to-sex experiences the guys have ever had.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Donnell "Ashy Larry" Rawlings
episodes.summary: This week, Neal's old "Chappelle's Show" buddy Donnell sits down with the guys and tells stories about working with Neal. Donnell goes after Moshe a bit for peppering in jokes in the middle of Donnell's stories. Finally, Neal outs Donnell as a notorious hot-head and angry text sender (reading his texts on-air).  Moshe recounts his weeks at Burning Man, and the guys all talk about what they're ashamed of.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Craig Robinson
episodes.summary: The star of "The Office" and "Hot Tub Time Machine" sits down with the guys and discusses getting arrested, pulling girl's hair on command, and his years as a school teacher in Chicago.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: NBA Star Blake Griffin (part 2) + Comedian Leslie Jones
episodes.summary: In part 2 of Blake Griffin, we discuss Blake's summer workout, his fear of being considered a bust after his rookie injury, and running over a squirrel with his car.  Then Leslie Jones shows up and berates Blake about the state of the NBA, and says she didn't know about the Dunk Contest because it wasn't on the news.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: NBA Star Blake Griffin
episodes.summary: For some reason, NBA Rookie of the Year Blake Griffin stops by to talk to the Champs.  In Part 1 (of 2) They discuss on-court flatulence, possible nicknames, Blake's Car-Jumping Dunk, Sean Kemp, and how the Champs would beat him up if he tested them.  You won't believe what a good, funny dude Blake Griffin is.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Ian Edwards
episodes.summary: This week, the guys sit down with comedian Ian Edwards and discuss Ian's upbringing in Jamaica, philosopies on who to sleep with in the comedy industry, violent hecklers, and Neal unveils his idea for a controversially named state of the art school and hospital in Harlem.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Champs with Neal Brennan + Moshe Kasher
episodes.title: Jerrod Carmichael
episodes.summary:
This weekly podcast features Neal Brennan (co-creator of "Chappelle's
Show"), Moshe Kasher (Late Night w/ Jimmy Fallon, Chelsea Lately,
Comedy Central) and DJ Douggpound (Tim and Eric, Awesome Show)
talking about whatever pops into their stupid heads Every
episode, they welcome a different black guest host.
